column5: River fishing has been tough lately so it was nice to finally find a fresh run of December chrome. Even managed to hit a bonus Brown. Didn't use a single roe sac as steelies and this Brown found a pink Riverworm to their liking. Cheers.
nice report and a gorgeous lookin' fish! keep em' comin
Great report and pics silverstreak  Beautiful colors on that brown.... Congratulations Thanks for sharing Leechman
funny I can only get them to hit the powerworms ... Those Riverwood's just don't give as much action compared to the powerworms IMO...Good to see you got some on them..
Nice brown!  I've always found that the products I make and market work best as well.
Nice photography or Gorgeous fish? A bit of Both.  Good job!

Here's a chunk of steel that also hit a Pink Riverworm. Hey solo......did you want me to lie and say it was caught on a berkley worm? Anyhow it was a great day for artificials.To bad about all the blood on the snow though. Lord knows what we would do if we couldn't use roe.

No...don't lie, but be a little more upfront with what you're trying to do.   I personally love all of your products and use them regularly and from what I've been told you're a decent guy as well... it's just that your posts are bordering on spam. (In a subtle way  )
Nice fish!!!!  What was the blood all over the bank for?  Last time I checked,  fish don't bleed when you milk them....

OK boy's I don't want this to turn into a pissing match. Solo......Point taken however product names are used everyday. Billy.....careful. Round one with the driveway now complete. I love snow just not shovelling. Cheers.

Nice brown & some winter steel you got there !!!.  ..pink roe bags were always my favourite color too,the company that made the spawnee,roe tying machine used to make a dull pink color mesh,and other than fishing in dirty water,it was the best overall color hands down !!!!   i wonder if they still make that color,as i dont do much trib fishin anymore cause of my screwed up back ....cheers
